intro: Acinodendron holosericeum var. pauciflorum, commonly known as the rare tropical evergreen shrub, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and lance-shaped leaves with a smooth surface. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
